name: src/compiler-base.js
CompilerBase
description:
This class is the base interface for compilers that are used by 
electron-compile. If your compiler library only supports a 
synchronous API, use SimpleCompilerBase instead.

name: getInputMimeTypes
description:
This method describes the MIME types that your compiler supports as input. 
Many precompiled file types don't have a specific MIME type, so if it's not
recognized by the mime-types package, you need to patch rig-mime-types in
electron-compile.

return.description: An array of MIME types that this compiler can compile.

name: shouldCompileFile
description: Determines whether a file should be compiled

params.name: fileName
params.description: The full path of a file to compile.

params.name: compilerContext
params.description:
An object that compilers can add extra
                                   information to as part of a job - the caller
                                   won't do anything with this.

return.description: True if you are able to compile this file.

name: determineDependentFiles
description:
Returns the dependent files of this file. This is used for languages such
as LESS which allow you to import / reference other related files. In future
versions of electron-compile, we will use this information to invalidate
all of the parent files if a child file changes.

params.name: fileName
params.description: The full path of a file to compile.

params.name: compilerContext
params.description:
An object that compilers can add extra
                                   information to as part of a job - the caller
                                   won't do anything with this.

return.description:
An array of dependent file paths, or an empty
                               array if there are no dependent files.

params.name: fileName
params.description: The full path of a file to compile.

params.name: compilerContext
params.description:
An object that compilers can add extra
                                   information to as part of a job - the caller
                                   won't do anything with this.

properties.name: mimeType
properties.description:
The MIME type of the compiled result, which 
                               should exist in the mime-types database.

return.description: An object representing the compiled result

name: shouldCompileFileSync
description: Determines whether a file should be compiled

params.name: fileName
params.description: The full path of a file to compile.

params.name: compilerContext
params.description:
An object that compilers can add extra
                                   information to as part of a job - the caller
                                   won't do anything with this.

return.description: True if you are able to compile this file.

name: determineDependentFilesSync
description:
Returns the dependent files of this file. This is used for languages such
as LESS which allow you to import / reference other related files. In future
versions of electron-compile, we will use this information to invalidate
all of the parent files if a child file changes.

params.name: fileName
params.description: The full path of a file to compile.

params.name: compilerContext
params.description:
An object that compilers can add extra
                                   information to as part of a job - the caller
                                   won't do anything with this.

return.description:
An array of dependent file paths, or an empty
                               array if there are no dependent files.

params.name: fileName
params.description: The full path of a file to compile.

params.name: compilerContext
params.description:
An object that compilers can add extra
                                   information to as part of a job - the caller
                                   won't do anything with this.

properties.name: mimeType
properties.description:
The MIME type of the compiled result, which 
                               should exist in the mime-types database.

return.description: An object representing the compiled result

name: getCompilerVersion
description:
Returns a version number representing the version of the underlying 
compiler library. When this number changes, electron-compile knows
to throw all away its generated code.

return.description:
A version number. Note that this string isn't 
                  parsed in any way, just compared to the previous
                  one for equality.

name: SimpleCompilerBase
description:
This class implements all of the async methods of CompilerBase by just 
calling the sync version. Use it to save some time when implementing 
simple compilers.

src/passthrough.js
PassthroughCompiler
access:
private

This class is used for binary files and other files that should end up in 
your cache directory, but aren't actually compiled
